maml:description.maml:para: Adds a free-form or multivalued custom field to IPAM.

The Add-IpamCustomField cmdlet adds a custom field to IP Address Management (IPAM). Specify a name for the custom field. By default, a custom field is free-form. Specify the MultiValue parameter to indicate that the custom field is multivalued.
Specifies a name for the custom field.

Runs the cmdlet as a background job. Use this parameter to run commands that take a long time to complete. The cmdlet immediately returns an object that represents the job and then displays the command prompt. You can continue to work in the session while the job completes. To manage the job, use the *-Job cmdlets. To get the job results, use the Receive-Job cmdlet. For more information about Windows PowerShell® background jobs, see about_Jobs.

Runs the cmdlet in a remote session or on a remote computer. Enter a computer name or a session object, such as the output of a New-CimSession or Get-CimSession cmdlet. The default is the current session on the local computer.
Indicates that the custom field is multivalued.
Returns an object representing the item with which you are working. By default, this cmdlet does not generate any output.

Specifies the maximum number of concurrent operations that can be established to run the cmdlet. If this parameter is omitted or a value of 0 is entered, then Windows PowerShell® calculates an optimum throttle limit for the cmdlet based on the number of CIM cmdlets that are running on the computer. The throttle limit applies only to the current cmdlet, not to the session or to the computer.
Specifies an array of values for the custom field.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

Runs the cmdlet as a background job. Use this parameter to run commands that take a long time to complete. The cmdlet immediately returns an object that represents the job and then displays the command prompt. You can continue to work in the session while the job completes. To manage the job, use the *-Job cmdlets. To get the job results, use the Receive-Job cmdlet. For more information about Windows PowerShell® background jobs, see about_Jobs.

Runs the cmdlet in a remote session or on a remote computer. Enter a computer name or a session object, such as the output of a New-CimSession or Get-CimSession cmdlet. The default is the current session on the local computer.
Indicates that the custom field is multivalued.
Specifies a name for the custom field.
Returns an object representing the item with which you are working. By default, this cmdlet does not generate any output.

Specifies the maximum number of concurrent operations that can be established to run the cmdlet. If this parameter is omitted or a value of 0 is entered, then Windows PowerShell® calculates an optimum throttle limit for the cmdlet based on the number of CIM cmdlets that are running on the computer. The throttle limit applies only to the current cmdlet, not to the session or to the computer.
Specifies an array of values for the custom field.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
This object contains an IPAM custom field.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Add a custom field
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Add-IpamCustomField -Name "CustomField01" -PassThru Name Category Multivalue CustomValue --------------------------------------------------------------------------------- CustomField01 UserDefined False

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command adds a custom field named CustomField01 to the IPAM server and returns the custom field object. By default, the custom field is free-form.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Add a multivalued custom field
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Add-IpamCustomField -Name "CustomMVField02" -MultiValue -PassThru Name Category Multivalue CustomValue --------------------------------------------------------------------------------- CustomMVField02 UserDefined True

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command adds a multivalued custom field named CustomMVField02 to the IPAM server, and returns the custom field object.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets custom fields in IPAM.

The Get-IpamCustomField gets information about custom fields in IP Address Management (IPAM). If you do not specify the Name parameter, this cmdlet retrieves all the custom fields in IPAM. For multivalued custom fields, the cmdlet retrieves the custom field objects and the associated custom values.
Specifies the name of a custom field.

Runs the cmdlet as a background job. Use this parameter to run commands that take a long time to complete. The cmdlet immediately returns an object that represents the job and then displays the command prompt. You can continue to work in the session while the job completes. To manage the job, use the *-Job cmdlets. To get the job results, use the Receive-Job cmdlet. For more information about Windows PowerShell® background jobs, see about_Jobs.

Runs the cmdlet in a remote session or on a remote computer. Enter a computer name or a session object, such as the output of a New-CimSession or Get-CimSession cmdlet. The default is the current session on the local computer.

Specifies the maximum number of concurrent operations that can be established to run the cmdlet. If this parameter is omitted or a value of 0 is entered, then Windows PowerShell® calculates an optimum throttle limit for the cmdlet based on the number of CIM cmdlets that are running on the computer. The throttle limit applies only to the current cmdlet, not to the session or to the computer.

Runs the cmdlet as a background job. Use this parameter to run commands that take a long time to complete. The cmdlet immediately returns an object that represents the job and then displays the command prompt. You can continue to work in the session while the job completes. To manage the job, use the *-Job cmdlets. To get the job results, use the Receive-Job cmdlet. For more information about Windows PowerShell® background jobs, see about_Jobs.

Runs the cmdlet in a remote session or on a remote computer. Enter a computer name or a session object, such as the output of a New-CimSession or Get-CimSession cmdlet. The default is the current session on the local computer.
Specifies the name of a custom field.

Specifies the maximum number of concurrent operations that can be established to run the cmdlet. If this parameter is omitted or a value of 0 is entered, then Windows PowerShell® calculates an optimum throttle limit for the cmdlet based on the number of CIM cmdlets that are running on the computer. The throttle limit applies only to the current cmdlet, not to the session or to the computer.
This object contains an IPAM custom field.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Retrieve all custom fields
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-IpamCustomField Name Category Multivalue CustomValue ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- AdSite BuiltIn False CountryOrRegion BuiltIn True {Afghanistan, Alfand Islands,...} ..... .....

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command retrieves all the built-in and user defined custom fields in the IPAM server. For multivalued fields, the command retrieves the custom field objects and the associated custom value objects.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Retrieve a custom field
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Get-IpamCustomField -Name "ManagedByService" Name Category Multivalue CustomValue ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- ManagedByService BuiltIn True {IPAM,MS DHCP,Non-MS DHCP...}

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command retrieves the custom field named ManagedByService and the corresponding custom value.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes a custom field from IPAM.

The Remove-IpamCustomField cmdlet removes a custom field from Internet Protocol address management (IPAM). You cannot remove a custom field that is assigned to other IPAM objects or is associated with other custom fields. Use the Remove-IpamCustomFieldAssociation cmdlet to remove an association between two custom fields.
Specifies the name of a custom field.

Runs the cmdlet as a background job. Use this parameter to run commands that take a long time to complete. The cmdlet immediately returns an object that represents the job and then displays the command prompt. You can continue to work in the session while the job completes. To manage the job, use the *-Job cmdlets. To get the job results, use the Receive-Job cmdlet. For more information about Windows PowerShell® background jobs, see about_Jobs.

Runs the cmdlet in a remote session or on a remote computer. Enter a computer name or a session object, such as the output of a New-CimSession or Get-CimSession cmdlet. The default is the current session on the local computer.
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation.
Returns an object representing the item with which you are working. By default, this cmdlet does not generate any output.

Specifies the maximum number of concurrent operations that can be established to run the cmdlet. If this parameter is omitted or a value of 0 is entered, then Windows PowerShell® calculates an optimum throttle limit for the cmdlet based on the number of CIM cmdlets that are running on the computer. The throttle limit applies only to the current cmdlet, not to the session or to the computer.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

To manage the job, use the *-Job cmdlets. To get the job results, use the Receive-Job cmdlet. For more information about Windows PowerShell® background jobs, see about_Jobs.

The throttle limit applies only to the current cmdlet, not to the session or to the computer.

Represents a custom metadata field in IPAM Server.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Remove a custom field
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Remove-IpamCustomField -Name "Building_Main" Confirm
This command will permanently delete the Building_Main Custom Field from IPAM. Do you want to continue?
[Y] Yes [N] No [S] Suspend [?] Help (default is "Y"): Y

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command removes the custom field named Building_Main from the IPAM server.

maml:description.maml:para: Renames a custom field in IPAM.

The Rename-IpamCustomField cmdlet renames a user-defined custom field in Internet Protocol address management (IPAM). The cmdlet changes only the name of the custom field. Associations with other custom fields and assignments to other IPAM objects remain valid. You cannot rename a built-in custom field in IPAM.
Specifies the name of a custom field.
Specifies a new name for the custom field.

Runs the cmdlet as a background job. Use this parameter to run commands that take a long time to complete. command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Rename a user defined custom field

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command renames the user-defined custom field named Building.
